content:
I'm trying to do String.replace <string here> "pattern" "replacement", but I get:
Test.lean:8:8: error: type mismatch
s.replace "\x0d\n" "\n"
has type
String : Type
but is expected to have type
IO ?m.180 : Type
I can't find any reference to ?m.180 type on the documentation, and the String.replace documentation says it accepts three strings?
What if you do pure (s.replace "\x0d " " ") instead of just s.replace "\x0d " " ""?
Thank you! That worked. I'll go read up on that now.
?m.180 is a "metavariable". It stands for anything, in particular it can stand for String (which is what you want here)
It just happens to be 180-th metavariable Lean has needed up to that point
